page.title: 01FARMLAND SOUTH OF BASCHURCH
page.content: Predominently a rural farming community with undulating land rising slightly towards the west. The River Perry, a tributary of the Severn, flows in a south-easterly direction across the north east corner of the area. Where also the War Brook flows south to join the Perry near Heaton. Three small villages, Little Ness, Yeaton and Grafton and one hamlet Nibs Heath are linked by minor roads. The 'B' class road from Shrewsbury to Baschurch crosses the north east section of the area. Straddling it are the old halls, farm buildings, new dormitory accommodation and teaching blocks comprising the Shropshire farm institute providing local employment for agricultural workers, domestics and some teachers. A girls public boarding/day school Adcote is situated in several acres of its own grounds
